title: Chartly Canonical Source (v1)
description: A Source defines an upstream input (API/domain/db/file/webhook). Source.config describes connection parameters and behavior but must not store secrets; secrets are supplied via environment variables or secret managers.

config.description: Source configuration (non-secret). Secrets must be referenced via env-var names, not stored here.

propertyNames.description: Reject common secret-like keys at the top level of config.

enabled.description: Whether this source is enabled for ingestion.

created_at.description: RFC3339 timestamp when the source was created.

updated_at.description: RFC3339 timestamp when the source was last updated.
